We'd really encourage you to really evaluate that, look back on that and see if it's just the jaded attitude of your family and friends about it that makes you think now it's not real. Is it something like that versus no, it was real and you need to recapture that. And we'd be happy to talk with you about it and pray with you about it too anytime. Good conversation guys. Thank you for joining us for this episode of Reconstructed Faith. If you enjoyed what you heard or were challenged, please leave us a review. It'll help other people find us. If you have questions or a topic you'd like to hear discussed, shoot me an email at info at southspring.org. Reconstructed Faith is a resource of South Spring Baptist Church. Remember, don't give up. Trust God. Search for answers.

not, it can be so disheartening like, Oh, but if you knew up front, no, the friendship you have with
those high school students is so real and so deep and so powerful. And it's so wonderful. And it also
probably won't last the rest of your life. Both are true. It's not that one, Oh, and so many adults
are like, Oh, the friendships you have now that they don't matter. They're, they're going to go
away. You're going to know, of course they matter. Yeah. But they're probably also going to go away.
Yeah. And so all of those things are true simultaneously. And we don't need to minimize
any of them. We, we have highs and it's awesome to have a high and you probably won't stay high
forever. And then you're going to have lows and lows can be really, really painful. We learn a
lot of the lows, but we can be really, really painful. We write good poetry there. Um, and
they're also not going to last forever. Yeah. So, and it just reminds me of the things that we've
talked about a lot on this podcast of it's also that more, much more important to remind yourself
of truth and realize what you're putting your hope in because those things are good and real.
But if your hope is in the high or the emotion or the friends that are going to last forever,
and then they go away at some point and your hope was in that, then the low is going to be
even lower. And it just pushes us back to even our relationship with the Lord,
not our feeling about that relationship. That is such a great point. That's we,
that's back to our themes. That's we, another thing we probably need more of us need to
deconstruct is our faith and our feelings that I trust of how I feel. And that's sufficient to
carry me through. And no, it's not that our feelings are. And that is so countercultural.
Yes, it is. For right now. Because your own experience is all emotive, you know,
like we were talking about with Dan. So that's awesome.
Motions are fantastic and they're vitally important and they're super powerful and they're
a wonderful gift from God, except when they're a curse sometimes. But they also are still just
emotions. And to treat them as somehow more real than external reality is a mistake. They are real,
but they are real emotions. And that's, man, those are some great, some great reminders
and good things to think about. So if you're one of those people who had a mountain top experience,
and then you walked away from it and you're like, I just don't, it wasn't real. We'd really
encourage you to really evaluate that, look back on that and see if it's just the jaded attitude
of your family and friends about it that makes you think now it's not real. Is it something like
that versus no, it was real and you need to recapture that. And we'd be happy to talk with
you about it and pray with you about it too anytime. Good conversation guys.
Thank you for joining us for this episode of Reconstructed Faith. If you enjoyed what you
heard or were challenged, please leave us a review. It'll help other people find us.
If you have questions or a topic you'd like to hear discussed, shoot me an email at info
at southspring.org. Reconstructed Faith is a resource of South Spring Baptist Church.
Remember, don't give up. Trust God. Search for answers.
